name: Dinner Tonight: Linguine with Mussels and Kale
description: [Photograph: Nick Kindelsperger] I've never really found an inopportune time to have mussels. During winter, the little bivalves can be covered in rich sauces that coat both them and your stomach. For summer, they can be dressed lightly. This recipe...
recipeIngredient: 1 onion, quartered, and thinly sliced crosswise
6 large kale leaves, stems and ribs discarded, chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add a few tablespoons of salt and then add the pasta. Cook according to the directions on the package until al dente. Make sure to reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta water. When pasta is done, drain and set aside.
Meanwhile, pour 4 tablespoons of the oil into a large pot set over high heat. Toss in the onion, garlic, and crushed red pepper. Stir often and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the mussels to the pot. Stir well and cook until about half of them have opened, about 2 to 3 minutes. Then add the chopped kale, stir well again, and cook for 3 to 4 minutes.
Dump in the cooked linguine and the reserved pasta water. Cook until all the mussels are open, stirring often, about 2 minutes. Season with salt, and drizzle with the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil.
